page.title: 05A Visit to Passenham
page.content:
Farming - Passenham is a farming community. Rape,wheat and barley are sown in the fields and cattle graze in the meadows. One of the main problems is flooding. The mill was powered by water and used to grind corn but it ceased to operate in 1920. The Manor House is up for sale at the moment. The previous owners died and it is uncertain who is going to buy it. In the grounds of the Manor House is a 16th Century Tithe Barn. It is still used for storage but now only for agricultural machinery.
Religion - The church is called St.Guthlac's. In the mid 19th Century a new church was built at Deanshanger. As a result St.Guthlac's assumed less imporance. Today about 15-20 people attend. On the 2nd and 4th Sunday of the month is Holy Communion at 9.00a.m.
